sen.j: 巧如（ぎょうにょ 1376年（天授 (日本)2年/永和 (日本)2年） - 1440年11月8日（永享12年10月14日 (旧暦)））は、浄土真宗の僧で、本願寺第6世。
sen.e: Gyonyo (1376-November 8,1440) was a Buddhist monk and the sixth chief priest of the Hongan-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「第６世」は「第６世住持職」として訳しました。
sen.e: Gyonyo (1376 - November 8,1440) was a Buddhist monk and the sixth chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple.
Gyonyo (1376 - November 8,1440) was a monk of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) and the sixth chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple.
His posthumous name was Genko.
sen.cmt: 玄康→読みが不明です。「Genko」としました。

His different pseudonym was Shojokaku.
sen.cmt: 證定閣→読みが不明です。「Shojokaku」としましたが、「Shoteikaku」、「Akashijokaku」、「Akashiteikaku」なども考えられます。
sen.e: His other pseudonym was Shojokaku.

His childhood name was Hikaritagamaro.

sen.j: 本願寺第5世・綽如の第二子として誕生し、日野資康の猶子となる。
sen.e: He was born as the second child of Shakunyo, the fifth chief priest of the Hongan-ji Temple and became an adopted child of Sukeyasu HINO.
He was born as the second child of Shakunyo, the fifth chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple, and became an adopted child of Sukeyasu HINO.

sen.j: 1394年（応永元年）に本願寺住持職を継承し、とくに北陸への教化に尽力。
sen.e: In 1394, he succeeded to the position of chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple and made every effort to enlighten the Hokuriku Districts.
In 1394, he succeeded to a position as chief priest of Hongan-ji Temple and made every effort to enlighten the Hokuriku districts.

sen.j: 弟の屯円を越前国の藤島超勝寺に、4男の如乗を越中国瑞泉寺 (南砺市)に派遣した。
sen.e: He dispatched Tonen, his younger brother to Fujishima Tosho-ji Temple, and Nyojo, his forth son to Zuisen-ji Temple in Nanto City in Ecchu Province.
He dispatched his younger brother Tonen to Fujishima Tosho-ji Temple and his fourth son Nyojo to Zuisen-ji Temple in Nanto City, Ecchu Province.
He dispatched his younger brother Tonen to Fujishima Chosho-ji Temple and his fourth son Nyojo to Zuisen-ji Temple in Nanto City, Ecchu Province.

sen.j: 1436年（永享8年）、長男・存如に職を譲り、1440年11月8日（永享12年10月14日）に65歳で逝去。
sen.e: In 1436, he gave up his post to Zonnyo, his eldest son and passed away in November 8, 1440 at the age of 65.
